intro: Oxytropis kunashiriensis, commonly known as the Kunashiri oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Russian Far East and is typically found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale yellow to reddish in color. Its leaves are palmately compound, with several leaflets arranged radiating from a central point. Oxytropis kunashiriensis is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
